# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function that does what you described:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text, r"\s+"))
    wrapped_lines = Any[]

    for line_words in eachindex(chunk(words, text_width + 1))))
        line = join(words[line_words]:words[line_words + text_width]]), " ")
        push!(wrapped_lines, line)
    end

    join(wrapped_lines, "\n")
end
```
And here's an example usage:
```julia
text = """
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer facilisis lacus ac est faucibus, at pulvinar justo blandit.

Nunc malesuada tortor sed felis sollicitudin, ut tristique risus imperdiet. Donec in arcu et mi rhoncus rutrum.
"""

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This code will split the long text into multiple lines with a maximum width of 10 characters (default value).
